posts.post_content:
You are missing something: [Bounteous Kirin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bounteous Kirin): Legendary Creature — Kirin Spirit (4/4) Flying. "*Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may gain life equal to that spell's converted mana cost*". [Cloudhoof Kirin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudhoof Kirin): Legendary Creature — Kirin Spirit (4/4) Flying. "*Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put the top X cards of target player's library into his or her graveyard, where X is that spell's converted mana cost*".  
  
I can mention so many card in the Kamigawa block with this kind of trick, 51 contain the words "when", "cast", "spirit" and "spell"... ([Sire of the Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sire of the Storm), [Skyfire Kirin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skyfire Kirin), [Thief of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thief of Hope))... or other, like [Primordial Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Sage). So **Zephyr Spirit** deserve a very honorable 1,5/5, nearly 2/5 for the creative Jonny player we are, because it gives you the possibility to cast it each turn and to block a big non flying creature.... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: holgir (8/3/2009 10:23:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Blue epic fail [Wall of Junk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Junk).  
Yes, it can attack and it doesn't take any damage either as opposed to other cards of that sort ([Phantom Whelp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantom Whelp), [Quicksilver Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicksilver Behemoth), [Windscouter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Windscouter) and the aforementioned wall).  
But why would you want wasting 6 freaking mana each time to get an attacking creature blocked? You could simply use any ability to tap the accordant creature instead (for example by using [Puppeteer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puppeteer)), which will keep it from attacking and triggering accordant abilities as well.  
And returning the Spirit isn't even optional (although even if it was, this card would still be terrible for 6 mana).  
  
I don't exactly know what Wizards thought when making this card, but apparently they were in [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp) common slot trolling mood again.
posts.html:
Blue epic fail Wall of Junk.
Yes, it can attack and it doesn't take any damage either as opposed to other cards of that sort (Phantom Whelp, Quicksilver Behemoth, Windscouter and the aforementioned wall).
But why would you want wasting 6 freaking mana each time to get an attacking creature blocked? You could simply use any ability to tap the accordant creature instead (for example by using Puppeteer), which will keep it from attacking and triggering accordant abilities as well.
And returning the Spirit isn't even optional (although even if it was, this card would still be terrible for 6 mana).

I don't exactly know what Wizards thought when making this card, but apparently they were in Chimney Imp common slot trolling mood again.
